waffleoRai_cafebotCommands

Class BotScheduler.DaySchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • waffleoRai_cafebotCommands.BotScheduler.DaySchedule
  • Enclosing class:
    BotScheduler

    public static class BotScheduler.DaySchedule
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper class for an array of shifts for a single day.
    Since:
    July 1, 2018
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Blythe Hospelhorn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DaySchedule(int nshifts)
      Construct a new DaySchedule with a set number of shifts.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BotScheduler.Shift getCurrentShift(int time_hr, int time_min)
      Given the current hour (24 hour scale) and minute, determine which shift should be the current shift and return the correlating Shift object.
      BotScheduler.Shift getShift(int i)
      Retrieve the ith Shift object (containing information about which bots occupy which positions during that shift) for this day.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DaySchedule

        public DaySchedule(int nshifts)
        Construct a new DaySchedule with a set number of shifts. The shift number cannot be changed later!
        Parameters:
        nshifts - The number of shifts in the day to construct the schedule for.

    • Method Detail

      • getShift

        public BotScheduler.Shift getShift(int i)
        Retrieve the ith Shift object (containing information about which bots occupy which positions during that shift) for this day.
        Parameters:
        i - The index number of the Shift to retrieve. Cannot be less than 0 and cannot be greater than or equal to nshifts - the number of shifts set during construction.
        Returns:
        The Shift object set for index i, if it was set. Otherwise, null. This function also returns null if the index is invalid rather than throwing an exception.

      • setShift

        public void setShift(int i,
                     BotScheduler.Shift s)
        Map a Shift to index i. This Shift will be set as the ith shift for the day.
        Parameters:
        i - The index to set the input Shift to. Must be between 0 (inclusive), and nshifts (exclusive). If this index value is invalid, this function will return without doing anything (it will NOT throw an exception).
        s - The Shift object to set as the ith shift. A null value may be used to unset the shift at index i.

      • getCurrentShift

        public BotScheduler.Shift getCurrentShift(int time_hr,
                                          int time_min)
        Given the current hour (24 hour scale) and minute, determine which shift should be the current shift and return the correlating Shift object. If there is no Shift mapped to the calculated index, this function will return null.
        Parameters:
        time_hr - The current hour on a 24-hour clock. Use 0 for 12AM. Valid values are 0-23 inclusive.
        time_min - The current minute. Valid values are 0-59 inclusive.
        Returns:
        The Shift that would be mapped to the provided time for this day.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the hour or minute values are invalid.
